verses.roman:
bāṇasya mantrī kumbhāṇḍaś
citralekhā ca tat-sutā
sakhy apṛcchat sakhīm ūṣāṁ
kautūhala-samanvitā

synonyms: bāṇasya—of Bāṇa; mantrī—the minister; kumbhāṇḍaḥ—Kumbhāṇḍa; Citralekhā—citralekhā; ca—and; tat—his; sutā—daughter; sakhī—the girlfriend; apṛcchat—she asked; sakhīm—her girīfriend; ūṣām—Ūṣā; kautūhala—with curiosity; samanvitā—full.
translation: Bāṇāsura had a minister named Kumbhāṇḍa, whose daughter was Citralekhā. A companion of Ūṣā's, she was filled with curiosity, and thus she inquired from her friend.
